activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6445
coronasafe/care_fe#6423
activity.text:
@Deepjyoti14 

We are allowing users to register a patient and then later come back and file consultation, so that they have enough time to collect all consultation details before attempting to file consultation.
The worry is, if we allow registration of patient and filing consultation together, the registration of patient also may get delayed. 

It is always a good idea to allow nurses to approach a large task in steps, Registration and then filing consultation, so that atleast 1 of the step gets performed. and then they can come back to the next.

However, we also know that some nurses forget to, or leave out filing consultation.

This is why we have added a label on the patient card for "No Consultation Filed"

The reason why such patients are not shown in dashboard is because dashboard today is only for patient admitted to the ICU. And admission to ICU is marked in consultation.

This is something that may be taken care of by strengthening training.

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6340
activity.text: > @aparnacoronasafe @SeyiesilieChadi we have decided to add an edit button, that behind the scenes will discontinue and create a new prescription with the edited attributes. > > @aparnacoronasafe just wanted to confirm, whether should we restrict the editing of certain fields (in both normal and PRN cases) > > * Medicine will not be editable- Yes. lets keep it like that > * Normal prescription CANNOT be converted to PRN prescription and vice versa via this method.- Yes. lets keep it like that > > Should any other fields be restricted from edit?- No. lets not restrict any other field > >

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6085
activity.text:
This is a good idea Rithvik.

If the user tries to select the exact same medicine from the medibase dataset, show a prompt saying the medicine is already there in prescription and allow user to edit the prescription for that medication.

To answer your questions, if medicine A is prescribes Once a day (morning) and the doctor wishes to make it thrice a day, hw must edit the existing prescription to change frequency (Not make a separate entry for Medicine A twice a day- Noon, evening)

The users dont understand JSON. The feature is not usable.

If CSV export is allowed, the hub admins can download list of assets in a facility, change the serial nos, facility names etc for another 10bedicu and import it to easily register the newer 10bedicu assets
